sentences.en: Barring accidents, I believe they will succeed.
sentences.cn: 不出意外的话，我相信他们会成功的。

sentences.en: David Rowland is almost certain to succeed him as chairman on January 1.
sentences.cn: 戴维·罗兰几乎肯定会在1月1日接替他当主席。

sentences.en: He has it in him to succeed.
He sacrificed his own career so that his avaricious brother could succeed.
sentences.cn: 他牺牲了自己的事业，这样他贪婪的弟弟才能成功。

sentences.en: He was too inexperienced and too inexpert to succeed.
sentences.cn: 他太缺乏经验，太不熟练，难以成功。

sentences.en: He's realistic enough to know he's not going to succeed overnight.
sentences.cn: 他很现实，知道自己的成功不会一蹴而就。

sentences.en: His critics write him off as too cautious to succeed.
sentences.cn: 批评他的人不把他当回事，认为他太过谨慎，不能成事。

sentences.en: His natural shrewdness tells him what is needed to succeed.
sentences.cn: 他与生俱来的精明告诉他成功所需要的一切。

sentences.en: His opposition acted as a goad to her determination to succeed.
sentences.cn: 他的反对反而刺激她坚定了取得成功的决心。

sentences.en: His son, Arthur Ochs Junior, is expected to succeed him as publisher.
sentences.cn: 他的儿子，小阿瑟·奥克斯，有望子承父业继续从事出版。

sentences.en: I have a sneaking suspicion that they are going to succeed.
sentences.cn: 我隐隐觉得他们恐怕要成功了。

sentences.en: I think that there is every chance that you will succeed.
sentences.cn: 我想你取得成功的机会很大。

sentences.en: If you believe in yourself you can succeed.
In the past he has pooh-poohed suggestions that he might succeed Isaacs.
sentences.cn: 过去他对自己会接替艾萨克斯之说嗤之以鼻。

sentences.en: Reeves will succeed Segal as Speaker of the House.
sentences.cn: 里夫斯将接替西格尔担任议院议长。。

sentences.en: She wanted to be the first woman to climb Mount Qomolangma, and she almost succeeded.
sentences.cn: 她本想成为第一位登上珠穆朗玛峰的女性，而且差一点就成功了。

sentences.en: To succeed, you must learn to overcome obstacles.
sentences.cn: 必须学会克服困难才能成功。

words.tran_cn: 连续的；继承的；依次的；接替的
成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物

phrases.tran_cn: 成功；在…方面成功；顺利完成
成功地做了…，成功地做某事

trans.tran_cn: 成功，达到，取得预期效果，（事业上）功成名就，接替，继承，继任，替换，替代（尤其指产品），一事成，事事成，反倒做了某事
trans.tran_en: to do what you tried or wanted to do
to do what you tried or wanted to do

trans.tran_cn: 接替， 继承； 继…之后
trans.tran_en: to be the next person to take a position or job after someone else
